intro: Angelica brachyradia, commonly known as the short-stemmed angelica, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its tall, slender stem and large, compound leaves that are deeply lobed. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in an umbel, typical of the carrot family. Angelica brachyradia is native to certain regions of Europe and is often found in moist, shaded habitats. Its roots and leaves have been used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
